result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua M Eytcheson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If the stayed portion of the sentence is imposed and there are outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall provide current financial information to the court.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Must report to the Department of Corrections by 3:00 PM on Friday, March 20, 2015.

miscConds.notes:
Per C-31. 
Must make $25.00 monthly payments towards restitution.

If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Must not possess or consume alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.

Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
Must apply for and successfully complete Rusk County Drug Court.
AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment.

Defendant Joshua M Eytcheson in court with attorney John Gerard Hinde.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
14CF313 & 14CM409
Plead guilty to 14CF313 Count 1 - Possession of meth with remaining counts dismissed and read-in.
14CM409 - dismissed and read-in.

Court questions defendant.  Felony admonitions given.  Defendant pleads guilty to count 1 in 14CF313, Court accepts and finds guilty.

Defense and State waive PSI.

Court dismisses and reads in remaining counts in 14CF313 and 14CM409 in its entirety.

Argument by State.
Argument by Attorney Hinde.
Defendant addresses Court.

Court relates and orders:
Imposed and stayed - 1 year Baron County jail with huber.  Credit for 2 days.
Probation 2 years
AODA and comply with all recommended treatment.
Comply with any other evaluation or treatment recommended by probation.
Apply for and successfully complete Rusk County Drug Court.
Court costs.
Not possess or consume alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
Restitution:  $44.84 & $119.00  =  $163.84 - payments of $25.00 per month.
Report to DOC by 3 PM on Friday, 03/20/2015.

Does not need to appear at PRH if current on payments.
 Review hearing scheduled for November 17, 2015 at 02:30 pm

Defendant Joshua M Eytcheson in court with attorney John G. Hinde.  Russell E. Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
This Covers 14CM409 and 14CF313. 

14CM409: Qualifies for PD. Waives further reading. Not guilty plea entered. 

14CF313: Preliminary Hearing. 
8:34: Brian Larson, Patrol Sargent with the Rice Lake Police Department, called, sworn and direct by State. 
8:36: Cross by Attorney Hinde. 
8:37: Court questions.
8:38: Testimony Closed.

State makes argument. 
Court finds probably cause and binds the Defendant over for trial. 
Information Filed. Waives formal reading. Defendant stands mute. Court enters a not guilty plea on the Defendants behalf.  Plea hearing scheduled for November 10, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-537-1191.

Defendant must have no contact with Rice Lake Wal-Mart store.
